allow-cross-origin-auth-prompt.comment: Allows third-party content included on a page to prompt for a HTTP basic auth username/password pair.

allow-file-access.comment: On ChromeOS, file:// access is disabled except for certain whitelisted directories. This switch re-enables file:// for testing.

allow-http-screen-capture.comment: Allow non-secure origins to use the screen capture API and the desktopCapture extension API.

allow-nacl-crxfs-api.comment: Specifies comma-separated list of extension ids or hosts to grant access to CRX file system APIs.

allow-nacl-file-handle-api.comment: Specifies comma-separated list of extension ids or hosts to grant access to file handle APIs.

allow-nacl-socket-api.comment: Specifies comma-separated list of extension ids or hosts to grant access to TCP/UDP socket APIs.

allow-running-insecure-content.comment: By default, an https page cannot run JavaScript, CSS or plug-ins from http URLs. This provides an override to get the old insecure behavior.

always-authorize-plugins.comment: Prevents Chrome from requiring authorization to run certain widely installed but less commonly used plug-ins.

app-id.comment: Specifies that the extension-app with the specified id should be launched according to its configuration.

app.comment: Specifies that the associated value should be launched in "application" mode.

app-list-start-page-url.comment: Specifies an URL to use for app list start page.

apps-checkout-url.comment: Overrides the apps checkout URL, which is used to determine when to expose some private APIs.

apps-gallery-download-url.comment: The URL that the webstore APIs download extensions from. Note: the URL must contain one '%s' for the extension ID.

apps-gallery-install-auto-confirm-for-te.comment: A setting to cause extension/app installs from the webstore skip the normal confirmation dialog. A value of 'accept' means to always act as if the dialog was accepted, and 'cancel' means to always act as if the dialog was cancelled. // TODO (rdevlin.cronin): Remove this. This is not a good use of a command-line flag, as it would be equally effective as a global boolean. Additionally, this opens up a dangerous way for attackers to append a commandline flag and circumvent all user action for installing an extension.

apps-gallery-url.comment: The URL to use for the gallery link in the app launcher.

apps-gallery-update-url.comment: The update url used by gallery/webstore extensions.

app-mode-auth-code.comment: Value of GAIA auth code for --force-app-mode.

app-mode-oauth-token.comment: Value of OAuth2 refresh token for --force-app-mode.

apps-new-install-bubble.comment: Whether to always use the new app install bubble when installing an app.

apps-use-native-frame.comment: Experimental native frame support for packaged apps.

auth-ext-path.comment: Enables overriding the path for the default authentication extension.

auth-negotiate-delegate-whitelist.comment: Whitelist of servers that Negotiate will generate delegated Kerberos tickets for.

auth-schemes.comment: HTTP authentication schemes to enable. This is a comma-separated list of authentication schemes (basic, digest, ntlm, and negotiate). By default all schemes are enabled. The primary use of this command line flag is to help triage authentication-related issues reported by end-users.

auth-server-whitelist.comment: Whitelist of servers which NTLM and Negotiate can automatically authenticate with using the default credentials of the currently logged in user.

auto-launch-at-startup.comment: A flag that is used to tell Chrome that it was launched automatically at computer startup and not by some user action.

certificate-transparency-log.comment: Certificate Transparency: Uses the provided log(s) for checking Signed Certificate Timestamps provided with certificates. The switch's value is:   log_description:log_key,log_description:log_key,... where   log_description is a textual description of the log.   log_key is a Base64'd DER-encoded SubjectPublicKeyInfo of the log's   public key. Multiple logs can be specified by repeating description:key pairs, separated by a comma.

check-for-update-interval.comment: How often (in seconds) to check for updates. Should only be used for testing purposes.

check-cloud-print-connector-policy.comment: Checks the cloud print connector policy, informing the service process if the policy is set to disallow the connector, then quits.

cipher-suite-blacklist.comment: Comma-separated list of SSL cipher suites to disable.

cloud-print-file.comment: Tells chrome to display the cloud print dialog and upload the specified file for printing.

cloud-print-file-type.comment: Specifies the mime type to be used when uploading data from the file referenced by cloud-print-file. Defaults to "application/pdf" if unspecified.

cloud-print-print-ticket.comment: Used with kCloudPrintFile to specify a JSON print ticket for the resulting print job. Defaults to null if unspecified.

cloud-print-job-title.comment: Used with kCloudPrintFile to specify a title for the resulting print job.

cloud-print-setup-proxy.comment: Setup cloud print proxy for provided printers. This does not start service or register proxy for autostart.

component-updater.comment: Comma-separated options to troubleshoot the component updater. Only valid for the browser process.

conflicting-modules-check.comment: Causes the browser process to inspect loaded and registered DLLs for known conflicts and warn the user.

crash-on-hang-threads.comment: Comma-separated list of BrowserThreads that cause browser process to crash if the given browser thread is not responsive. UI,IO,DB,FILE,CACHE are the list of BrowserThreads that are supported. // For example:    --crash-on-hang-threads=UI:3:18,IO:3:18 --> Crash the browser if UI or IO      is not responsive for 18 seconds and the number of browser threads that      are responding is less than or equal to 3.

create-browser-on-startup-for-tests.comment: Some platforms like ChromeOS default to empty desktop. Browser tests may need to add this switch so that at least one browser instance is created on startup. TODO(nkostylev): Investigate if this switch could be removed. (http://crbug.com/148675)

debug-enable-frame-toggle.comment: Enables a frame context menu item that toggles the frame in and out of glass mode (Windows Vista and up only).

debug-packed-apps.comment: Adds debugging entries such as Inspect Element to context menus of packed apps.

diagnostics.comment: Triggers a plethora of diagnostic modes.

diagnostics-format.comment: Sets the output format for diagnostic modes enabled by diagnostics flag.

diagnostics-recovery.comment: Tells the diagnostics mode to do the requested recovery step(s).

disable-async-dns.comment: Disables the experimental asynchronous DNS client.

disable-auth-negotiate-cname-lookup.comment: Disables CNAME lookup of the host when generating the Kerberos SPN for a Negotiate challenge. See HttpAuthHandlerNegotiate::CreateSPN for more background.

disable-background-mode.comment: Disables background mode (background apps will not keep chrome running in the background).

disable-background-networking.comment: Disable several subsystems which run network requests in the background. This is for use when doing network performance testing to avoid noise in the measurements.

disable-bundled-ppapi-flash.comment: Disables the bundled PPAPI version of Flash.

disable-client-side-phishing-detection.comment: Disables the client-side phishing detection feature. Note that even if client-side phishing detection is enabled, it will only be active if the user has opted in to UMA stats and SafeBrowsing is enabled in the preferences.

disable-component-extensions-with-backgr.comment: Disable default component extensions with background pages - useful for performance tests where these pages may interfere with perf results.

disable-crl-sets.comment: Disables establishing certificate revocation information by downloading a set of CRLs rather than performing on-line checks.

disable-default-apps.comment: Disables installation of default apps on first run. This is used during automated testing.

disable-extensions-file-access-check.comment: Disable checking for user opt-in for extensions that want to inject script into file URLs (ie, always allow it). This is used during automated testing.

disable-extensions-http-throttling.comment: Disable the net::URLRequestThrottlerManager functionality for requests originating from extensions.

disable-extensions-resource-whitelist.comment: Disable mandatory enforcement of web_accessible_resources in extensions.

disable-fullscreen-within-tab.comment: Disables embedding of Flash fullscreen widgets within the browser window. This restores the old code paths where Flash fullscreen would display in its own separate, always-on-top window.  In addition, this disables the new logic which would prevent fullscreening the browser window during screen-capture of a tab.  http://crbug.com/256870 and http://crbug.com/290403

disable-ipv6.comment: Don't resolve hostnames to IPv6 addresses. This can be used when debugging issues relating to IPv6, but shouldn't otherwise be needed. Be sure to file bugs if something isn't working properly in the presence of IPv6. This flag can be overidden by the "enable-ipv6" flag.

disable-minimize-on-second-launcher-item.comment: Disable the behavior that the second click on a launcher item (the click when the item is already active) minimizes the item.

disable-ntp-other-sessions-menu.comment: Disables the menu on the NTP for accessing sessions from other devices.

disable-origin-chip-v2.comment: Disable the origin chip in the location bar.

disable-password-manager-reauthenticatio.comment: Disable the setting to prompt the user for their OS account password before revealing plaintext passwords in the password manager.

disable-people-search.comment: Enables searching for people from the apps list search box.

disable-pnacl.comment: Disables the usage of Portable Native Client.

disable-prerender-local-predictor.comment: Disable prerendering based on local browsing history.

disable-prompt-on-repost.comment: Normally when the user attempts to navigate to a page that was the result of a post we prompt to make sure they want to. This switch may be used to disable that check. This switch is used during automated testing.

disable-quic.comment: Disables support for the QUIC protocol.

disable-quic-https.comment: Disables support for the HTTPS over QUIC protocol.  This is a temporary testing flag.  This only has an effect if QUIC protocol is enabled.

disable-quic-pacing.comment: Disable use of pacing of QUIC packets. This only has an effect if QUIC protocol is enabled.

disable-quic-port-selection.comment: Disable use of Chromium's port selection for the ephemeral port via bind(). This only has an effect if QUIC protocol is enabled.

disable-restore-background-contents.comment: Prevents the URLs of BackgroundContents from being remembered and re-launched when the browser restarts.

disable-save-password-bubble.comment: Prevents the save password bubble from being enabled.

disable-scripted-print-throttling.comment: Disables throttling prints initiated by scripts.

disable-search-button-in-omnibox.comment: Disables the "search button in omnibox" experiment.

disable-spdy31.comment: Disable SPDY/3.1. This is a temporary testing flag.

disable-sync.comment: Disables syncing browser data to a Google Account.

disable-sync-types.comment: Disables syncing one or more sync data types that are on by default. See sync/internal_api/public/base/model_type.h for possible types. Types should be comma separated, and follow the naming convention for string representation of model types, e.g.: --disable-synctypes='Typed URLs, Bookmarks, Autofill Profiles'

disable-user-media-security.comment: Disables some security measures when accessing user media devices like webcams and microphones, especially on non-HTTPS pages.

disable-web-resources.comment: Disables the backend service for web resources.

disable-zero-browsers-open-for-tests.comment: Some tests seem to require the application to close when the last browser window is closed. Thus, we need a switch to force this behavior for ChromeOS Aura, disable "zero window mode". TODO(pkotwicz): Investigate if this bug can be removed. (http://crbug.com/119175)

disk-cache-dir.comment: Use a specific disk cache location, rather than one derived from the UserDatadir.

disk-cache-size.comment: Forces the maximum disk space to be used by the disk cache, in bytes.

dump-browser-histograms.comment: Requests that a running browser process dump its collected histograms to a given file. The file is overwritten if it exists.

enable-app-list.comment: Enables the <adview> tag in packaged apps. If set, the app list will be enabled as if enabled from CWS.

enable-app-window-controls.comment: Enables the <window-controls> tag in platform apps.

enable-apps-show-on-first-paint.comment: Show apps windows after the first paint. Windows will be shown significantly later for heavy apps loading resources synchronously but it will be insignificant for apps that load most of their resources asynchronously.

enable-async-dns.comment: Enables the experimental asynchronous DNS client.

enable-auth-negotiate-port.comment: Enables the inclusion of non-standard ports when generating the Kerberos SPN in response to a Negotiate challenge. See HttpAuthHandlerNegotiate::CreateSPN for more background.

enable-automation-api.comment: Enables the Automation extension API. TODO(dtseng): Remove once API enabled for stable channel.

enable-client-hints.comment: Enables client hints, which adds hints about browser state to HTTP requests.

enable-bookmark-undo.comment: Enables the multi-level undo system for bookmarks.

enable-cloud-print-proxy.comment: This applies only when the process type is "service". Enables the Cloud Print Proxy component within the service process.

enable-devtools-experiments.comment: If true devtools experimental settings are enabled.

enable-extension-activity-logging.comment: Enables experimentation with ephemeral apps, which are launched without installing in Chrome. Enables logging for extension activity.

enable-fast-unload.comment: Enable the fast unload controller, which speeds up tab/window close by running a tab's onunload js handler independently of the GUI - crbug.com/142458 .

enable-ipv6.comment: Enables IPv6 support, even if probes suggest that it may not be fully supported. Some probes may require internet connections, and this flag will allow support independent of application testing. This flag overrides "disable-ipv6" which appears elswhere in this file.

enable-linkable-ephemeral-apps.comment: Enables experimentation with launching ephemeral apps via hyperlinks.

enable-metrics-reporting-for-testing.comment: Enables metrics recording and reporting in the browser startup sequence, as if this was an official Chrome build where the user allowed metrics reporting. This is used for testing only.

enable-nacl.comment: Runs the Native Client inside the renderer process and enables GPU plugin (internally adds lEnableGpuPlugin to the command line).

enable-network-time.comment: Enables |NetworkTimeService| to convert local time to network time.

enable-npn-http.comment: Enables NPN with HTTP. It means NPN is enabled but SPDY won't be used. HTTP is still used for all requests.

enable-offline-auto-reload.comment: Enable auto-reload of error pages if offline.

enable-origin-chip.comment: Controls which branch of the origin chip experiment is enabled. The first flag (enable-origin-chip) is equivalent to the third (enable-origin-chip-trailing-location-bar) and exists for backwards compatability with an earlier version of the experiment. // We're using independent flags here (as opposed to a common flag with different values) to be able to enable/disable the entire experience associated with this feature server-side from the FieldTrial (the complete experience includes other flag changes as well). It is not currently possible to do that with "flag=value" flags.

enable-origin-chip-v2.comment: Controls which branch of the origin chip in location bar experiment is enabled. // We're using independent flags here (as opposed to a common flag with different values) to be able to enable/disable the entire experience associated with this feature server-side from the FieldTrial (the complete experience includes other flag changes as well). It is not currently possible to do that with "flag=value" flags.

enable-panels.comment: Enables panels (always on-top docked pop-up windows).

enable-print-preview-register-promos.comment: Enables showing unregistered printers in print preview

enable-profiling.comment: Enables tracking of tasks in profiler for viewing via about:profiler. To predominantly disable tracking (profiling), use the command line switch: --enable-profiling=0 Some tracking will still take place at startup, but it will be turned off during chrome_browser_main.

enable-quic.comment: Enables support for the QUIC protocol.  This is a temporary testing flag.

enable-quic-https.comment: Enables support for the HTTPS over QUIC protocol.  This is a temporary testing flag.  This only has an effect if QUIC protocol is enabled.

enable-quic-pacing.comment: Disable use of pacing of QUIC packets. This only has an effect if QUIC protocol is enabled.

enable-quic-port-selection.comment: Enable use of Chromium's port selection for the ephemeral port via bind(). This only has an effect if QUIC protocol is enabled.

enable-search-button-in-omnibox-always.comment: Controls which branch of the "search button in omnibox" experiment is enabled. // We're using independent flags here (as opposed to a common flag with different values) to be able to enable/disable the entire experience associated with this feature server-side from the FieldTrial (the complete experience includes other flag changes as well). It is not currently possible to do that with "flag=value" flags.

enable-settings-window.comment: Enable settings in a separate browser window per profile.

enable-spdy4.comment: Enable SPDY/4, aka HTTP/2. This is a temporary testing flag.

enable-spelling-auto-correct.comment: Enables auto correction for misspelled words.

enable-spelling-feedback-field-trial.comment: Enables participation in the field trial for user feedback to spelling service.

enable-streamlined-hosted-apps.comment: Enables an experimental hosted app experience.

enable-thumbnail-retargeting.comment: Enables fanciful thumbnail processing. Used with NTP for instant-extended-api, where thumbnails are generally smaller.

enable-translate-new-ux.comment: Enables Translate experimental new UX which replaces the infobar.

enable-user-controlled-alternate-protoco.comment: Enables Alternate-Protocol when the port is user controlled (> 1024).

enable-watchdog.comment: Spawns threads to watch for excessive delays in specified message loops. User should set breakpoints on Alarm() to examine problematic thread. // Usage:   -enable-watchdog=[ui][io] // Order of the listed sub-arguments does not matter.

explicitly-allowed-ports.comment: Explicitly allows additional ports using a comma-separated list of port numbers.

extensions-install-verification.comment: Turns on extension install verification if it would not otherwise have been turned on.

extensions-not-webstore.comment: Specifies a comma-separated list of extension ids that should be forced to be treated as not from the webstore when doing install verification.

extensions-update-frequency.comment: Frequency in seconds for Extensions auto-update.

extra-search-query-params.comment: Additional query params to insert in the search and instant URLs.  Useful for testing.

fake-variations-channel.comment: Fakes the channel of the browser for purposes of Variations filtering. This is to be used for testing only. Possible values are "stable", "beta", "dev" and "canary". Note that this only applies if the browser's reported channel is UNKNOWN.

fast-start.comment: If this flag is present then this command line is being delegated to an already running chrome process via the fast path, ie: before chrome.dll is loaded. It is useful to tell the difference for tracking purposes.

flag-switches-begin.comment: These two flags are added around the switches about:flags adds to the command line. This is useful to see which switches were added by about:flags on about:version. They don't have any effect.

feedback-server.comment: Alternative feedback server to use when submitting user feedback

file-descriptor-limit.comment: The file descriptor limit is set to the value of this switch, subject to the OS hard limits. Useful for testing that file descriptor exhaustion is handled gracefully.

force-app-mode.comment: Forces application mode. This hides certain system UI elements and forces the app to be installed if it hasn't been already.

force-first-run.comment: Displays the First Run experience when the browser is started, regardless of whether or not it's actually the First Run (this overrides kNoFirstRun).

force-variation-ids.comment: Forces additional Chrome Variation Ids that will be sent in X-Client-Data header, specified as a 64-bit encoded list of numeric experiment ids. Ids prefixed with the character "t" will be treated as Trigger Variation Ids.

google-base-url.comment: Specifies an alternate URL to use for speaking to Google. Useful for testing.

gssapi-library-name.comment: Specifies a custom name for the GSSAPI library to load.

help.comment: These flags show the man page on Linux. They are equivalent to each other.

hide-icons.comment: Makes Windows happy by allowing it to show "Enable access to this program" checkbox in Add/Remove Programs->Set Program Access and Defaults. This only shows an error box because the only way to hide Chrome is by uninstalling it.

enable-grouped-history.comment: Enables grouping websites by domain and filtering them by period.

homepage.comment: Specifies which page will be displayed in newly-opened tabs. We need this for testing purposes so that the UI tests don't depend on what comes up for http://google.com.

host-rules.comment: Comma-separated list of rules that control how hostnames are mapped. // For example:    "MAP * 127.0.0.1" --> Forces all hostnames to be mapped to 127.0.0.1    "MAP *.google.com proxy" --> Forces all google.com subdomains to be                                 resolved to "proxy".    "MAP test.com [::1]:77 --> Forces "test.com" to resolve to IPv6 loopback.                               Will also force the port of the resulting                               socket address to be 77.    "MAP * baz, EXCLUDE www.google.com" --> Remaps everything to "baz",                                            except for "www.google.com". // These mappings apply to the endpoint host in a net::URLRequest (the TCP connect and host resolver in a direct connection, and the CONNECT in an http proxy connection, and the endpoint host in a SOCKS proxy connection).

host-resolver-parallelism.comment: The maximum number of concurrent host resolve requests (i.e. DNS) to allow (not counting backup attempts which would also consume threads). --host-resolver-retry-attempts must be set to zero for this to be exact.

host-resolver-retry-attempts.comment: The maximum number of retry attempts to resolve the host. Set this to zero to disable host resolver retry attempts.

ignore-urlfetcher-cert-requests.comment: Causes net::URLFetchers to ignore requests for SSL client certificates, causing them to attempt an unauthenticated SSL/TLS session. This is intended for use when testing various service URLs (eg: kPromoServerURL, kSbURLPrefix, kSyncServiceURL, etc)

incognito.comment: Causes the browser to launch directly in incognito mode.

install-chrome-app.comment: Causes Chrome to initiate an installation flow for the given app.

install-from-webstore.comment: Causes Chrome to attempt to get metadata from the webstore for the app/extension ID given, and then prompt the user to download and install it.

instant-process.comment: Marks a renderer as an Instant process.

invalidation-use-gcm-channel.comment: Invalidation service should use GCM network channel even if experiment is not enabled.

ipc-fuzzer-testcase.comment: Specifies the testcase used by the IPC fuzzer.

keep-alive-for-test.comment: Used for testing - keeps browser alive after last browser window closes.

kiosk-printing.comment: Print automatically in kiosk mode. |kKioskMode| must be set as well. See http://crbug.com/31395.

limited-install-from-webstore.comment: Causes Chrome to attempt to get metadata from the webstore for the given item, and then prompt the user to download and install it.

load-component-extension.comment: Comma-separated list of directories with component extensions to load.

load-extension.comment: Loads an extension from the specified directory.

managed-user-id.comment: Sets the managed user ID for any loaded or newly created profile to the given value. Pass an empty string to mark the profile as non-supervised. Used for testing.

managed-user-sync-token.comment: Used to authenticate requests to the Sync service for managed users. Setting this switch also causes Sync to be set up for a managed user.

manual-enhanced-bookmarks.comment: Use to opt-in user into Finch experiment groups.

media-cache-size.comment: Forces the maximum disk space to be used by the media cache, in bytes.

memory-profile.comment: Enables dynamic loading of the Memory Profiler DLL, which will trace all memory allocations during the run.

message-loop-histogrammer.comment: Enables histograming of tasks served by MessageLoop. See about:histograms/Loop for results, which show frequency of messages on each thread, including APC count, object signalling count, etc.

metrics-recording-only.comment: Enables the recording of metrics reports but disables reporting. In contrast to kDisableMetrics, this executes all the code that a normal client would use for reporting, except the report is dropped rather than sent to the server. This is useful for finding issues in the metrics code during UI and performance tests.

net-log-level.comment: Sets the base logging level for the net log. Log 0 logs the most data. Intended primarily for use with --log-net-log.

no-default-browser-check.comment: Disables the default browser check. Useful for UI/browser tests where we want to avoid having the default browser info-bar displayed.

no-displaying-insecure-content.comment: By default, an https page can load images, fonts or frames from an http page. This switch overrides this to block this lesser mixed-content problem.

no-events.comment: Don't record/playback events when using record & playback.

no-experiments.comment: Disables all experiments set on about:flags. Does not disable about:flags itself. Useful if an experiment makes chrome crash at startup: One can start chrome with --no-experiments, disable the problematic lab at about:flags and then restart chrome without this switch again.

no-first-run.comment: Skip First Run tasks, whether or not it's actually the First Run. Overridden by kForceFirstRun. This does not drop the First Run sentinel and thus doesn't prevent first run from occuring the next time chrome is launched without this flag.

no-js-randomness.comment: Support a separate switch that enables the v8 playback extension. The extension causes javascript calls to Date.now() and Math.random() to return consistent values, such that subsequent loads of the same page will result in consistent js-generated data and XHR requests. Pages may still be able to generate inconsistent data from plugins.

no-network-profile-warning.comment: Whether or not the browser should warn if the profile is on a network share. This flag is only relevant for Windows currently.

no-proxy-server.comment: Don't use a proxy server, always make direct connections. Overrides any other proxy server flags that are passed.

no-service-autorun.comment: Disables the service process from adding itself as an autorun process. This does not delete existing autorun registrations, it just prevents the service from registering a new one.

no-startup-window.comment: Does not automatically open a browser window on startup (used when launching Chrome for the purpose of hosting background apps).

no-managed-user-acknowledgment-check.comment: Disables checking whether we received an acknowledgment when registering a supervised user. Also disables the timeout during registration that waits for the ack. Useful when debugging against a server that does not support notifications.

num-pac-threads.comment: Specifies the maximum number of threads to use for running the Proxy Autoconfig (PAC) script.

new-window.comment: Launches URL in new browser window.

origin-to-force-quic-on.comment: Force use of QUIC for requests to the specified origin.

original-process-start-time.comment: The time that a new chrome process which is delegating to an already running chrome process started. (See ProcessSingleton for more details.)

out-of-process-pdf.comment: Enable the out of process PDF plugin.

pack-extension.comment: Packages an extension to a .crx installable file from a given directory.

pack-extension-key.comment: Optional PEM private key to use in signing packaged .crx.

parent-profile.comment: Specifies the path to the user data folder for the parent profile.

performance-monitor-gathering.comment: Launches PerformanceMonitor at startup, which will gather statistics about Chrome's CPU and memory usage, page load times, startup times, and network usage, and will also store information about events which may be of interest, such as extension-related occurrences and crashes. Optionally, this may be run with an integer value representing the interval between the timed metric gatherings, measured in seconds (if invalid or not provided, the default interval is used).

playback-mode.comment: Read previously recorded data from the cache. Only cached data is read. See kRecordMode.

ppapi-flash-path.comment: Use the PPAPI (Pepper) Flash found at the given path.

ppapi-flash-version.comment: Report the given version for the PPAPI (Pepper) Flash. The version should be numbers separated by '.'s (e.g., "12.3.456.78"). If not specified, it defaults to "10.2.999.999".

prefetch-search-results.comment: Triggers prerendering of search base page to prefetch results for the typed omnibox query. Only has an effect when prerender is enabled.

prerender-from-omnibox.comment: Triggers prerendering of pages from suggestions in the omnibox. Only has an effect when Instant is either disabled or restricted to search, and when prerender is enabled.

auto.comment: These are the values the kPrerenderMode switch may have, as in "--prerender=auto".   auto: Allow field trial selection for prerender.

prerender.comment: Controls speculative prerendering of pages, and content prefetching. Both are dispatched from <link rel=prefetch href=...> elements.

privet-ipv6-only.comment: Use IPv6 only for privet HTTP.

product-version.comment: Outputs the product version information and quit. Used as an internal api to detect the installed version of Chrome on Linux.

profile-directory.comment: Selects directory of profile to associate with the first browser launched.

profiling-at-start.comment: Starts the sampling based profiler for the browser process at startup. This will only work if chrome has been built with the gyp variable profiling=1. The output will go to the value of kProfilingFile.

profiling-file.comment: Specifies a location for profiling output. This will only work if chrome has been built with the gyp variable profiling=1. //   {pid} if present will be replaced by the pid of the process.   {count} if present will be incremented each time a profile is generated           for this process. The default is chrome-profile-{pid}.

profiling-output-file.comment: Specifies a path for the output of task-level profiling which can be loaded and viewed in about:profiler.

profiling-flush.comment: Controls whether profile data is periodically flushed to a file. Normally the data gets written on exit but cases exist where chrome doesn't exit cleanly (especially when using single-process). A time in seconds can be specified.

promo-server-url.comment: Specifies a custom URL for fetching NTP promo data.

proxy-bypass-list.comment: Specifies a list of hosts for whom we bypass proxy settings and use direct connections. Ignored if --proxy-auto-detect or --no-proxy-server are also specified. This is a comma-separated list of bypass rules. See: "net/proxy/proxy_bypass_rules.h" for the format of these rules.

proxy-pac-url.comment: Uses the pac script at the given URL

proxy-server.comment: Uses a specified proxy server, overrides system settings. This switch only affects HTTP and HTTPS requests.

quic-max-packet-length.comment: Specifies the maximum length for a QUIC packet.

quic-version.comment: Specifies the version of QUIC to use.

record-mode.comment: Chrome supports a playback and record mode.  Record mode saves *everything* to the cache.  Playback mode reads data exclusively from the cache.  This allows us to record a session into the cache and then replay it at will. See also kPlaybackMode.

renderer-print-preview.comment: Enables print preview in the renderer. This flag is generated internally by Chrome and does nothing when directly passed to the browser.

reset-app-list-install-state.comment: If set, the app list will forget it has been installed on startup. Note this doesn't prevent the app list from running, it just makes Chrome think the app list hasn't been enabled (as in kEnableAppList) yet.

reset-variation-state.comment: Forces a reset of the one-time-randomized FieldTrials on this client, also known as the Chrome Variations state.

restore-last-session.comment: Indicates the last session should be restored on startup. This overrides the preferences value and is primarily intended for testing. The value of this switch is the number of tabs to wait until loaded before 'load completed' is sent to the ui_test.

save-page-as-mhtml.comment: Disable saving pages as HTML-only, disable saving pages as HTML Complete (with a directory of sub-resources). Enable only saving pages as MHTML. See http://crbug.com/120416 for how to remove this switch.

safebrowsing-disable-auto-update.comment: If present, safebrowsing only performs update when SafeBrowsingProtocolManager::ForceScheduleNextUpdate() is explicitly called. This is used for testing only.

safebrowsing-disable-download-protection.comment: TODO(lzheng): Remove this flag once the feature works fine (http://crbug.com/74848). // Disables safebrowsing feature that checks download url and downloads content's hash to make sure the content are not malicious.

safebrowsing-disable-extension-blacklist.comment: Disables safebrowsing feature that checks for blacklisted extensions.

safebrowsing-disable-side-effect-free-wh.comment: Disables safebrowsing feature that provides a side-effect free whitelist.

service.comment: Causes the process to run as a service process.

set-token.comment: Sets a token in the token service, for testing.

show-app-list.comment: If true the app list will be shown.

signin-process.comment: Marks a renderer as the signin process.

silent-debugger-extension-api.comment: Does not show an infobar when an extension attaches to a page using chrome.debugger page. Required to attach to extension background pages.

silent-dump-on-dcheck.comment: Changes the DCHECKS to dump memory and continue instead of displaying error dialog. This is valid only in Release mode when gyp dcheck_always_on=1.

silent-launch.comment: Causes Chrome to launch without opening any windows by default. Useful if one wishes to use Chrome as an ash server.

simulate-critical-update.comment: Simulates a critical update being available.

simulate-outdated.comment: Simulates that current version is outdated.

simulate-outdated-no-au.comment: Simulates that current version is outdated and auto-update is off.

spelling-service-feedback-url.comment: Specifies the URL where spelling service feedback data will be sent instead of the default URL. This switch is for temporary testing only. TODO(rouslan): Remove this flag when feedback testing is complete. Revisit by August 2013.

spelling-service-feedback-interval-secon.comment: Specifies the number of seconds between sending batches of feedback to spelling service. The default is 30 minutes. The mininum is 5 seconds. This switch is for temporary testing only. TODO(rouslan): Remove this flag when feedback testing is complete. Revisit by August 2013.

ssl-version-max.comment: Specifies the maximum SSL/TLS version ("ssl3", "tls1", "tls1.1", or "tls1.2").

ssl-version-min.comment: Specifies the minimum SSL/TLS version ("ssl3", "tls1", "tls1.1", or "tls1.2").

start-maximized.comment: Starts the browser maximized, regardless of any previous settings.

suggestion-ntp-filter-width.comment: Controls the width of time-of-day filters on the 'suggested' ntp page, in minutes.

suggestion-ntp-gaussian-filter.comment: Enables a normal distribution dropoff to the relevancy of visits with respect to the time of day.

suggestion-ntp-linear-filter.comment: Enables a linear dropoff to the relevancy of visits with respect to the time of day.

sync-allow-insecure-xmpp-connection.comment: Allows insecure XMPP connections for sync (for testing).

sync-invalidate-xmpp-login.comment: Invalidates any login info passed into sync's XMPP connection.

sync-short-initial-retry-override.comment: This flag causes sync to retry very quickly (see polling_constants.h) the when it encounters an error, as the first step towards exponential backoff.

sync-notification-host-port.comment: Overrides the default host:port used for sync notifications.

sync-url.comment: Overrides the default server used for profile sync.

sync-throw-unrecoverable-error.comment: Makes the sync code to throw an unrecoverable error after initialization. Useful for testing unrecoverable error scenarios.

sync-try-ssltcp-first-for-xmpp.comment: Tries to connect to XMPP using SSLTCP first (for testing).

sync-disable-deferred-startup.comment: Enables deferring sync backend initialization until user initiated changes occur.

sync-deferred-startup-timeout-seconds.comment: Allows overriding the deferred init fallback timeout.

sync-enable-get-update-avoidance.comment: Enables feature to avoid unnecessary GetUpdate requests.

enable-syncfs-directory-operation.comment: Enables directory support for sync filesystem

test-name.comment: Passes the name of the current running automated test to Chrome.

trusted-spdy-proxy.comment: Disables same-origin check on HTTP resources pushed via a SPDY proxy. The value is the host:port of the trusted proxy.

try-chrome-again.comment: Experimental. Shows a dialog asking the user to try chrome. This flag is to be used only by the upgrade process.

uninstall-extension.comment: Uninstalls an extension with the specified extension id.

uninstall.comment: Runs un-installation steps that were done by chrome first-run.

unlimited-storage.comment: Overrides per-origin quota settings to unlimited storage for any apps/origins.  This should be used only for testing purpose.

use-spdy.comment: Uses Spdy for the transport protocol instead of HTTP. This is a temporary testing flag.

use-spelling-suggestions.comment: Disables use of the spelling web service and only provides suggestions. This will only work if asynchronous spell checking is not disabled.

user-agent.comment: A string used to override the default user agent with a custom one.

user-data-dir.comment: Specifies the user data directory, which is where the browser will look for all of its state.

validate-crx.comment: Examines a .crx for validity and prints the result.

use-simple-cache-backend.comment: Uses experimental simple cache backend if possible.

variations-server-url.comment: Specifies a custom URL for the server which reports variation data to the client. Specifying this switch enables the Variations service on unofficial builds. See variations_service.cc.

winhttp-proxy-resolver.comment: Uses WinHTTP to fetch and evaluate PAC scripts. Otherwise the default is to use Chromium's network stack to fetch, and V8 to evaluate.

plugins-metadata-server-url.comment: Specifies a custom URL for fetching plug-ins metadata. Used for testing.

disable-cast.comment: Disables support for playing videos on Chromecast devices.

disable-zero-suggest.comment: Disables zero suggest experiment on Dev channel.

enable-zero-suggest-ether-serp.comment: Enables zero suggest functionality on Dev channel, showing contextual suggestions (EtherSuggest) for http pages and google.com search queries.

enable-zero-suggest-ether-noserp.comment: Enables zero suggest functionality on Dev channel, showing contextual suggestions (EtherSuggest) for http pages.

enable-zero-suggest-most-visited.comment: Enables zero suggest functionality on Dev channel, showing most visited sites as default suggestions.

enable-zero-suggest-personalized.comment: Enables zero suggest functionality on Dev channel, showing recently typed queries as default suggestions.

password-store.comment: Specifies which password store to use (detect, default, gnome, kwallet).

migrate-data-dir-for-sxs.comment: Triggers migration of user data directory to another directory specified as a parameter. The migration is done under singleton lock, and sanity checks are made to avoid corrupting the profile. The browser exits after migration is complete.

enable-speech-dispatcher.comment: Allows sending text-to-speech requests to speech-dispatcher, a common Linux speech service. Because it's buggy, the user must explicitly enable it so that visiting a random webpage can't cause instability.

apps-keep-chrome-alive.comment: Prevents Chrome from quitting when Chrome Apps are open.

disable-app-shims.comment: Disables the creation and launch of app shims for platform apps.

disable-system-fullscreen-for-testing.comment: Forcibly disables Lion-style on newer OSes, to allow developers to test the older, SnowLeopard-style fullscreen.

enable-simplified-fullscreen.comment: Enables a simplified fullscreen UI on Mac.

relauncher.comment: A process type (switches::kProcessType) that relaunches the browser. See chrome/browser/mac/relauncher.h.

enable-permissions-bubbles.comment: Use bubbles for content permissions requests instead of infobars.

enable-cloud-print-xps.comment: Fallback to XPS. By default connector uses CDD.

enable-profile-shortcut-manager.comment: Force-enables the profile shortcut manager. This is needed for tests since they use a custom-user-data-dir which disables this.

force-immersive.comment: For the DelegateExecute verb handler to launch Chrome in metro mode on Windows 8 and higher.  Used when relaunching metro Chrome.

force-desktop.comment: For the DelegateExecute verb handler to launch Chrome in desktop mode on Windows 8 and higher.  Used when relaunching metro Chrome.

relaunch-shortcut.comment: Relaunches metro Chrome on Windows 8 and higher using a given shortcut.

viewer-connect.comment: Requests that Chrome connect to the running Metro viewer process.

viewer-launch-via-appid.comment: Requests that Chrome launch the Metro viewer process via the given appid (which is assumed to be registered as default browser) and synchronously connect to it.

wait-for-mutex.comment: Waits for the given handle to be signaled before relaunching metro Chrome on Windows 8 and higher.

windows8-search.comment: Indicates that chrome was launched to service a search request in Windows 8.

debug-print.comment: Enables support to debug printing subsystem.

filemgr-ext-path.comment: Enables overriding the path of file manager extension.

disable-print-preview.comment: Disables print preview (For testing, and for users who don't like us. :[ )

enable-print-preview.comment: Enables print preview. Chromium normally does not have the PDF viewer, required for print preview. pdf.dll or libpdf.so should be present in primary directory of Chromium. For local builds it's usually out/Debug or out/Release.

canvas-msaa-sample-count.comment: The number of MSAA samples for canvas2D. Requires MSAA support by GPU to have an effect. 0 disables MSAA.

allow-file-access-from-files.comment: By default, file:// URIs cannot read other file:// URIs. This is an override for developers who need the old behavior for testing.

allow-loopback-in-peer-connection.comment: Allows loopback interface to be added in network list for peer connection.

allow-no-sandbox-job.comment: Enables the sandboxed processes to run without a job object assigned to them. This flag is required to allow Chrome to run in RemoteApps or Citrix. This flag can reduce the security of the sandboxed processes and allow them to do certain API calls like shut down Windows or access the clipboard. Also we lose the chance to kill some processes until the outer job that owns them finishes.

allow-sandbox-debugging.comment: Allows debugging of sandboxed processes (see zygote_main_linux.cc).

enable-handle-auditing-all.comment: The same as kAuditHandles except all handles are enumerated.

enable-handle-auditing.comment: Enumerates and prints a child process' most dangerous handles when it is terminated.

blink-platform-log-channels.comment: Choose which logging channels in blink platform to activate.  See Logging.cpp in blink's Source/platform for a list of available channels.

block-cross-site-documents.comment: Block cross-site documents (i.e., HTML/XML/JSON) from being loaded in subresources when a document is not supposed to read them.  This will later allow us to block them from the entire renderer process when site isolation is enabled.

assert-test.comment: Causes the browser process to throw an assertion on startup.

crash-test.comment: Causes the browser process to crash on startup.

browser-subprocess-path.comment: Path to the exe to run for the renderer and plugin subprocesses.

debug-plugin-loading.comment: Dumps extra logging about plugin loading to the log file.

default-tile-width.comment: Sets the tile size used by composited layers.

disable-3d-apis.comment: Disables client-visible 3D APIs, in particular WebGL and Pepper 3D. This is controlled by policy and is kept separate from the other enable/disable switches to avoid accidentally regressing the policy support for controlling access to these APIs.

disable-accelerated-fixed-root-backgroun.comment: Disables accelerated compositing for backgrounds of root layers with background-attachment: fixed.

disable-accelerated-layers.comment: Disables the hardware acceleration of 3D CSS and animation.

disable-accelerated-overflow-scroll.comment: Disables accelerated compositing for overflow scroll.

disable-accelerated-video-decode.comment: Disables hardware acceleration of video decode, where available.

disable-winsta.comment: Disables the alternate window station for the renderer.

disable-backing-store-limit.comment: Disable limits on the number of backing stores. Can prevent blinking for users with many windows/tabs and lots of memory.

disable-desktop-notifications.comment: Disables desktop notifications (default enabled on windows).

disable-navigator-content-utils.comment: Disables experimental navigator content utils implementation.

disable-direct-npapi-requests.comment: Handles URL requests by NPAPI plugins through the renderer.

disable-webgl.comment: Disable running the SharedWorker inside the renderer process. Disable experimental WebGL support.

disable-fast-text-autosizing.comment: Disable the fast text autosizing implementation.

disable-filters-over-ipc.comment: Disables sending filters (SkImageFilter objects) between processes over IPC

disable-gesture-debounce.comment: Disable deferral of scroll-ending gesture events when a scroll is active.

disable-gpu.comment: Disables GPU hardware acceleration.  If software renderer is not in place, then the GPU process won't launch.

disable-gpu-compositing.comment: Prevent the compositor from using its GPU implementation.

disable-low-res-tiling.comment: Disable GPU rasterization, i.e. rasterize on the CPU only. Overrides the kEnableGpuRasterization and kForceGpuRasterization flags. When using CPU rasterizing disable low resolution tiling. This uses less power, particularly during animations, but more white may be seen during fast scrolling especially on slower devices.

disable-gpu-watchdog.comment: Disable the thread that crashes the GPU process if it stops responding to messages.

disable-hang-monitor.comment: Suppresses hang monitor dialogs in renderer processes.  This may allow slow unload handlers on a page to prevent the tab from closing, but the Task Manager can be used to terminate the offending process in this case.

disable-impl-side-painting.comment: Paint content on the main thread instead of the compositor thread. Overrides the kEnableImplSidePainting flag.

disable-javascript.comment: Don't execute JavaScript (browser JS like the new tab page still runs).

disable-kill-after-bad-ipc.comment: Don't kill a child process when it sends a bad IPC message.  Apart from testing, it is a bad idea from a security perspective to enable this switch.

disable-prefixed-encrypted-media.comment: Disables prefixed Encrypted Media API (e.g. webkitGenerateKeyRequest()).

disable-logging.comment: Force logging to be disabled.  Logging is enabled by default in debug builds.

disable-map-image.comment: Disable rasterizer that writes directly to GPU memory. Overrides the kEnableMapImage flag.

disable-media-source.comment: Disables Media Source API (i.e., the MediaSource object).

disable-plugins-discovery.comment: Disable discovering third-party plug-ins. Effectively loading only ones shipped with the browser plus third-party ones as specified by --extra-plugin-dir and --load-plugin switches.

disable-remote-fonts.comment: Disables remote web font support. SVG font should always work whether this option is specified or not.

disable-renderer-accessibility.comment: Turns off the accessibility in the renderer.

disable-repaint-after-layout.comment: Disables the new layout/paint system which paints after layout is complete.

disable-seccomp-filter-sandbox.comment: Disable the seccomp filter sandbox (seccomp-bpf) (Linux only).

disable-shared-workers.comment: Enable shared workers. Functionality not yet complete.

disable-site-specific-quirks.comment: Disables site-specific tailoring to compatibility issues in WebKit.

disable-software-rasterizer.comment: Disables the use of a 3D software rasterizer.

disable-ssl-false-start.comment: Disable False Start in SSL and TLS connections.

disable-threaded-compositing.comment: Disable multithreaded GPU compositing of web content.

disable-threaded-html-parser.comment: Disables the threaded HTML parser in Blink

disable-universal-accelerated-overflow-s.comment: Disable accelerated overflow scrolling in corner cases (that would not be handled by enable-accelerated-overflow-scroll).

disable-web-security.comment: Don't enforce the same-origin policy. (Used by people testing their sites.)

disable-xss-auditor.comment: Disables Blink's XSSAuditor. The XSSAuditor mitigates reflective XSS.

dom-automation.comment: Specifies if the |DOMAutomationController| needs to be bound in the renderer. This binding happens on per-frame basis and hence can potentially be a performance bottleneck. One should only enable it when automating dom based tests.

enable-bleeding-edge-rendering-fast-path.comment: Enable bleeding-edge code to make Chrome draw content faster. The changes behind this path are very likely to break lots of content. ** DO NOT use this flag unless you know what you are doing. **

enable-accelerated-fixed-root-background.comment: Enables accelerated compositing for backgrounds of root layers with background-attachment: fixed.

enable-accelerated-overflow-scroll.comment: Enables accelerated compositing for overflow scroll. Promotes eligible overflow:scroll elements to layers to enable accelerated scrolling for them.

enable-layer-squashing.comment: Enables experimental feature that maps multiple RenderLayers to one composited layer to avoid pathological layer counts.

enable-accessibility-logging.comment: Turns on extremely verbose logging of accessibility events.

enable-begin-frame-scheduling.comment: Use a BeginFrame signal from browser to renderer to schedule rendering.

enable-browser-plugin-for-all-view-types.comment: Enables browser plugin for all types of pages.

enable-fixed-position-compositing.comment: Enable the creation of compositing layers for fixed position elements. Three options are needed to support four possible scenarios:  1. Default (disabled)  2. Enabled always (to allow dogfooding)  3. Disabled always (to give safety fallback for users)  4. Enabled only if we detect a highDPI display // Option #4 may soon be the default, because the feature is needed soon for high DPI, but cannot be used (yet) for low DPI. Options #2 and #3 will override Option #4.

enable-transition-compositing.comment: Enable/Disable the creation of compositing layers for RenderLayers with a transition on a property that supports accelerated animation (that is, opacity, -webkit-transform, and -webkit-filter), even when no animation is running. These options allow for three possible scenarios:  1. Default (enabled only if we dectect a highDPI display)  2. Enabled always.  3. Disabled always.

enable-deferred-image-decoding.comment: Defer image decoding in WebKit until painting.

enable-encrypted-media.comment: Enables support for Encrypted Media Extensions (e.g. MediaKeys).

enable-experimental-canvas-features.comment: Enable experimental canvas features, e.g. canvas 2D context attributes

enable-experimental-web-platform-feature.comment: Enables Web Platform features that are in development.

enable-file-cookies.comment: By default, cookies are not allowed on file://. They are needed for testing, for example page cycler and layout tests. See bug 1157243.

enable-fast-text-autosizing.comment: Enable the fast text autosizing implementation.

enable-gpu-client-tracing.comment: Enables TRACE for GL calls in the renderer.

enable-gpu-rasterization.comment: Allow heuristics to determine when a layer tile should be drawn with the Skia GPU backend. Only valid with GPU accelerated compositing + impl-side painting.

enable-low-res-tiling.comment: When using CPU rasterizing generate low resolution tiling. Low res tiles may be displayed during fast scrolls especially on slower devices.

disable-legacy-window.comment: Disable the Legacy Window which corresponds to the size of the WebContents.

enable-direct-write.comment: Enables the DirectWrite font rendering system on windows.

enable-high-resolution-time.comment: Use high resolution timers for TimeTicks.

enable-impl-side-painting.comment: Paint content on the compositor thread instead of the main thread.

enable-inband-text-tracks.comment: Enables support for inband text tracks in media content.

enable-logging.comment: Force logging to be enabled.  Logging is disabled by default in release builds.

enable-map-image.comment: Enable rasterizer that writes directly to GPU memory.

enable-shared-worker-memory-info.comment: Make the values returned to window.performance.memory more granular and more up to date in shared worker. Without this flag, the memory information is still available, but it is bucketized and updated less frequently.

enable-monitor-profile.comment: On Windows, converts the page to the currently-installed monitor profile. This does NOT enable color management for images. The source is still assumed to be sRGB.

enable-offline-cache-access.comment: Enables use of cache if offline, even if it's stale

enable-overlay-fullscreen-video.comment: Enables use of hardware overlay for fullscreen video playback. Android only.

disable-overlay-fullscreen-video-subtitl.comment: Disables blink subtitle and media control on top of overlay fullscreen video.

enable-overscroll-notifications.comment: Forward overscroll event data from the renderer to the browser.

enable-preparsed-js-caching.comment: Enable caching of pre-parsed JS script data.  See http://crbug.com/32407.

enable-privileged-webgl-extensions.comment: Enable privileged WebGL extensions; without this switch such extensions are available only to Chrome extensions.

enable-region-based-columns.comment: Enables the CSS multicol implementation that uses the regions implementation.

enable-repaint-after-layout.comment: Enables the new layout/paint system which paints after layout is complete.

enable-sandbox-logging.comment: Cause the OS X sandbox write to syslog every time an access to a resource is denied by the sandbox.

enable-seccomp-filter-sandbox.comment: Enables seccomp-bpf support for Android. Requires experimental kernel support. <http://crbug.com/166704>

enable-smooth-scrolling.comment: On platforms that support it, enables smooth scroll animation.

enable-speech-synthesis.comment: Enables the synthesis part of the Web Speech API.

enable-stats-table.comment: Enables StatsTable, logging statistics to a global named shared memory table.

enable-strict-site-isolation.comment: Experimentally ensures that each renderer process: 1) Only handles rendering for pages from a single site, apart from iframes. (Note that a page can reference content from multiple origins due to images, JavaScript files, etc.  Cross-site iframes are also loaded in-process.) 2) Only has authority to see or use cookies for the page's top-level origin. (So if a.com iframes b.com, the b.com network request will be sent without cookies.) This is expected to break compatibility with many pages for now.  Unlike the --site-per-process flag, this allows cross-site iframes, but it blocks all cookies on cross-site requests.

enable-service-worker.comment: Enable support for ServiceWorker. See https://github.com/slightlyoff/ServiceWorker for more information.

enable-service-worker-sync.comment: Enable support for sync events in ServiceWorkers.

enable-tcp-fastopen.comment: Enable use of experimental TCP sockets API for sending data in the SYN packet.

enable-threaded-compositing.comment: Enable multithreaded GPU compositing of web content.

enable-universal-accelerated-overflow-sc.comment: Enable accelerated overflow scrolling in all cases.

enable-usermedia-screen-capturing.comment: Enable screen capturing support for MediaStream API.

enable-viewport.comment: Enables the use of the @viewport CSS rule, which allows pages to control aspects of their own layout. This also turns on touch-screen pinch gestures.

enable-viewport-meta.comment: Enables the use of the legacy viewport meta tag. Turning this on also turns on the @viewport CSS rule

main-frame-resizes-are-orientation-chang.comment: Resizes of the main frame are the caused by changing between landscape and portrait mode (i.e. Android) so the page should be rescaled to fit

enable-web-animations-svg.comment: Enable SVG Animations on the Web Animations model.

enable-webgl-draft-extensions.comment: Enables WebGL extensions not yet approved by the community.

extra-plugin-dir.comment: Load NPAPI plugins from the specified directory.

force-fieldtrials.comment: Some field trials may be randomized in the browser, and the randomly selected outcome needs to be propagated to the renderer. For instance, this is used to modify histograms recorded in the renderer, or to get the renderer to also set of its state (initialize, or not initialize components) to match the experiment(s). The option is also useful for forcing field trials when testing changes locally. The argument is a list of name and value pairs, separated by slashes. See FieldTrialList::CreateTrialsFromString() in field_trial.h for details.

force-gpu-rasterization.comment: Always use the Skia GPU backend for drawing layer tiles. Only valid with GPU accelerated compositing + impl-side painting. Overrides the kEnableGpuRasterization flag.

force-renderer-accessibility.comment: Force renderer accessibility to be on instead of enabling it on demand when a screen reader is detected. The disable-renderer-accessibility switch overrides this if present.

gpu-device-id.comment: Passes gpu device_id from browser process to GPU process.

gpu-driver-vendor.comment: Passes gpu driver_vendor from browser process to GPU process.

gpu-driver-version.comment: Passes gpu driver_version from browser process to GPU process.

gpu-launcher.comment: Extra command line options for launching the GPU process (normally used for debugging). Use like renderer-cmd-prefix.

gpu-process.comment: Makes this process a GPU sub-process.

gpu-sandbox-allow-sysv-shm.comment: Allow shmat system call in GPU sandbox.

gpu-sandbox-start-after-initialization.comment: Allow GPU sandbox to start later

gpu-startup-dialog.comment: Causes the GPU process to display a dialog on launch.

gpu-vendor-id.comment: Passes gpu vendor_id from browser process to GPU process.

host-resolver-rules.comment: These mappings only apply to the host resolver.

in-process-gpu.comment: Run the GPU process as a thread in the browser process.

js-flags.comment: Specifies the flags passed to JS engine

load-plugin.comment: Load an NPAPI plugin from the specified path.

log-gpu-control-list-decisions.comment: Logs GPU control list decisions when enforcing blacklist rules.

log-level.comment: Sets the minimum log level. Valid values are from 0 to 3: INFO = 0, WARNING = 1, LOG_ERROR = 2, LOG_FATAL = 3.

log-net-log.comment: Enables saving net log events to a file and sets the file name to use.

log-plugin-messages.comment: Make plugin processes log their sent and received messages to VLOG(1).

max-untiled-layer-height.comment: Sets the width and height above which a composited layer will get tiled.

memory-metrics.comment: Sample memory usage with high frequency and store the results to the Renderer.Memory histogram. Used in memory tests.

mute-audio.comment: Mutes audio sent to the audio device so it is not audible during automated testing.

no-sandbox.comment: Disables the sandbox for all process types that are normally sandboxed.

num-raster-threads.comment: Number of worker threads used to rasterize content.

overscroll-history-navigation.comment: Enables or disables history navigation in response to horizontal overscroll. Set the value to '1' to enable the feature, and set to '0' to disable. Defaults to enabled.

plugin-launcher.comment: Specifies a command that should be used to launch the plugin process.  Useful for running the plugin process through purify or quantify.  Ex:   --plugin-launcher="path\to\purify /Run=yes"

plugin-path.comment: Tells the plugin process the path of the plugin to load

plugin.comment: Causes the process to run as a plugin subprocess.

plugin-startup-dialog.comment: Causes the plugin process to display a dialog on launch.

ppapi-broker.comment: Argument to the process type that indicates a PPAPI broker process type.

ppapi-flash-args.comment: "Command-line" arguments for the PPAPI Flash; used for debugging options.

ppapi.comment: Argument to the process type that indicates a PPAPI plugin process type.

ppapi-startup-dialog.comment: Causes the PPAPI sub process to display a dialog on launch. Be sure to use --no-sandbox as well or the sandbox won't allow the dialog to display.

process-per-site.comment: Runs a single process for each site (i.e., group of pages from the same registered domain) the user visits.  We default to using a renderer process for each site instance (i.e., group of pages from the same registered domain with script connections to each other).

process-per-tab.comment: Runs each set of script-connected tabs (i.e., a BrowsingInstance) in its own renderer process.  We default to using a renderer process for each site instance (i.e., group of pages from the same registered domain with script connections to each other).

type.comment: The value of this switch determines whether the process is started as a renderer or plugin host.  If it's empty, it's the browser.

reduce-security-for-testing.comment: Enables more web features over insecure connections. Designed to be used for testing purposes only.

register-pepper-plugins.comment: Register Pepper plugins (see pepper_plugin_list.cc for its format).

remote-debugging-port.comment: Enables remote debug over HTTP on the specified port.

renderer-assert-test.comment: Causes the renderer process to throw an assertion on launch.

renderer-cmd-prefix.comment: On POSIX only: the contents of this flag are prepended to the renderer command line. Useful values might be "valgrind" or "xterm -e gdb --args".

renderer.comment: Causes the process to run as renderer instead of as browser.

renderer-process-limit.comment: Overrides the default/calculated limit to the number of renderer processes. Very high values for this setting can lead to high memory/resource usage or instability.

renderer-startup-dialog.comment: Causes the renderer process to display a dialog on launch.

sandbox-ipc.comment: Causes the process to run as a sandbox IPC subprocess.

scroll-end-effect.comment: Enables or disables scroll end effect in response to vertical overscroll. Set the value to '1' to enable the feature, and set to '0' to disable. Defaults to disabled.

show-paint-rects.comment: Visibly render a border around paint rects in the web page to help debug and study painting behavior.

simulate-touch-screen-with-mouse.comment: Map mouse input events into touch gesture events.  Useful for debugging touch gestures without needing a touchscreen.

single-process.comment: Runs the renderer and plugins in the same process as the browser

site-per-process.comment: Experimentally enforces a one-site-per-process security policy. All cross-site navigations force process swaps, and we can restrict a renderer process's access rights based on its site.  For details, see: http://www.chromium.org/developers/design-documents/site-isolation // Unlike --enable-strict-site-isolation (which allows cross-site iframes), this flag does not affect which cookies are attached to cross-site requests. Support is being added to render cross-site iframes in a different process than their parent pages.

skip-gpu-data-loading.comment: Skip gpu info collection, blacklist loading, and blacklist auto-update scheduling at browser startup time. Therefore, all GPU features are available, and about:gpu page shows empty content. The switch is intended only for layout tests. TODO(gab): Get rid of this switch entirely.

start-fullscreen.comment: Specifies if the browser should start in fullscreen mode, like if the user had pressed F11 right after startup.

enable-stats-collection-bindings.comment: Specifies if the |StatsCollectionController| needs to be bound in the renderer. This binding happens on per-frame basis and hence can potentially be a performance bottleneck. One should only enable it when running a test that needs to access the provided statistics.

tab-capture-upscale-quality.comment: Scaling quality for capturing tab. Should be one of "fast", "good" or "best". One flag for upscaling, one for downscaling. Upscale defaults to "best".

testing-fixed-http-port.comment: Allows for forcing socket connections to http/https to use fixed ports.

test-sandbox.comment: Runs the security test for the renderer sandbox.

test-type.comment: Type of the current test harness ("browser" or "ui").

touch-ack-timeout-delay-ms.comment: Enable timeout-based touch event cancellation if a touch ack is delayed. If unspecified, touch timeout behavior will be disabled.

trace-shutdown.comment: Causes TRACE_EVENT flags to be recorded beginning with shutdown. Optionally, can specify the specific trace categories to include (e.g. --trace-shutdown=base,net) otherwise, all events are recorded. --trace-shutdown-file can be used to control where the trace log gets stored to since there is otherwise no way to access the result.

trace-shutdown-file.comment: If supplied, sets the file which shutdown tracing will be stored into, if omitted the default will be used "chrometrace.log" in the current directory. Has no effect unless --trace-shutdown is also supplied. Example: --trace-shutdown --trace-shutdown-file=/tmp/trace_event.log

trace-startup.comment: Causes TRACE_EVENT flags to be recorded from startup. Optionally, can specify the specific trace categories to include (e.g. --trace-startup=base,net) otherwise, all events are recorded. Setting this flag results in the first call to BeginTracing() to receive all trace events since startup. In Chrome, you may find --trace-startup-file and --trace-startup-duration to control the auto-saving of the trace (not supported in the base-only TraceLog component).

trace-startup-duration.comment: Sets the time in seconds until startup tracing ends. If omitted a default of 5 seconds is used. Has no effect without --trace-startup, or if --startup-trace-file=none was supplied.

trace-startup-file.comment: If supplied, sets the file which startup tracing will be stored into, if omitted the default will be used "chrometrace.log" in the current directory. Has no effect unless --trace-startup is also supplied. Example: --trace-startup --trace-startup-file=/tmp/trace_event.log As a special case, can be set to 'none' - this disables automatically saving the result to a file and the first manually recorded trace will then receive all events since startup.

use-fake-device-for-media-stream.comment: Overrides the preferred discardable memory implementation. Use fake device for MediaStream to replace actual camera and microphone.

use-fake-ui-for-media-stream.comment: Bypass the media stream infobar by selecting the default device for media streams (e.g. WebRTC). Works with --use-fake-device-for-media-stream.

use-mobile-user-agent.comment: Set when Chromium should use a mobile user agent.

utility-cmd-prefix.comment: On POSIX only: the contents of this flag are prepended to the utility process command line. Useful values might be "valgrind" or "xterm -e gdb --args".

utility.comment: Causes the process to run as a utility subprocess.

utility-allowed-dir.comment: The utility process is sandboxed, with access to one directory. This flag specifies the directory that can be accessed.

utility-enable-mdns.comment: Allows MDns to access network in sandboxed process.

validate-input-event-stream.comment: In debug builds, asserts that the stream of input events is valid.

wait-for-debugger-children.comment: Will add kWaitForDebugger to every child processes. If a value is passed, it will be used as a filter to determine if the child process should have the kWaitForDebugger flag passed on or not.

webgl-command-buffer-size-kb.comment: Overrides the amount of shared memory the webgl command buffer allocates

worker.comment: Causes the process to run as a worker subprocess.

zygote-cmd-prefix.comment: The prefix used when starting the zygote process. (i.e. 'gdb --args')

zygote.comment: Causes the process to run as a renderer zygote.

enable-audio-track-processing.comment: Enables audio processing in a MediaStreamTrack. When this flag is on, AEC, NS and AGC will be done per MediaStreamTrack instead of in PeerConnection.

disable-webrtc-hw-decoding.comment: Disables HW decode acceleration for WebRTC.

disable-webrtc-encryption.comment: Disables encryption of RTP Media for WebRTC. When Chrome embeds Content, it ignores this switch on its stable and beta channels.

disable-webrtc-hw-encoding.comment: Disables HW encode acceleration for WebRTC.

enable-webrtc-tcp-server-socket.comment: Enables WebRTC to open TCP server sockets.

enable-webrtc-hw-vp8-encoding.comment: Enables VP8 HW encode acceleration for WebRTC.

disable-gesture-requirement-for-media-fu.comment: Disable user gesture requirement for the media element to enter fullscreen.

disable-gesture-requirement-for-media-pl.comment: Disable user gesture requirement for media playback.

disable-media-history.comment: Disable history logging for media elements.

disable-click-delay.comment: Disable the click delay by sending click events during double tap.

disable-overscroll-edge-effect.comment: Disable overscroll edge effects like those found in Android views.

disable-webrtc.comment: WebRTC is enabled by default on Android.

enable-speech-recognition.comment: Enable the recognition part of the Web Speech API.

force-use-overlay-embedded-video.comment: Always use the video overlay for the embedded video. This switch is intended only for tests.

network-country-iso.comment: The telephony region (ISO country code) to use in phone number detection.

remote-debugging-socket-name.comment: Enables remote debug over HTTP on the specified socket name.

disable-panel-fitting.comment: Disables panel fitting (used for mirror mode).

disable-core-animation-plugins.comment: Disables support for Core Animation plugins. This is triggered when accelerated compositing is disabled. See http://crbug.com/122430 .

enable-crash-reporter.comment: Indicates that crash reporting should be enabled. On platforms where helper processes cannot access to files needed to make this decision, this flag is generated internally.

noerrdialogs.comment: Suppresses all error dialogs when present.

test-child-process.comment: When running certain tests that spawn child processes, this switch indicates to the test framework that the current process is a child process.

<span class=\"pygments-n\">kV<\/span>: \.comment: Gives the default maximal active V-logging level; 0 is the default. Normally positive values are used for V-logging levels.

vmodule.comment: Gives the per-module maximal V-logging levels to override the value given by --v.  E.g. "my_module=2,foo*=3" would change the logging level for all code in source files "my_module.*" and "foo*.*" ("-inl" suffixes are also disregarded for this matching). // Any pattern containing a forward or backward slash will be tested against the whole pathname and not just the module.  E.g., "*/foo/bar/*=2" would change the logging level for all code in source files under a "foo/bar" directory.

wait-for-debugger.comment: Will wait for 60 seconds for a debugger to come to attach to the process.

trace-to-console.comment: Sends a pretty-printed version of tracing info to the console.

profiler-timing.comment: Configure whether chrome://profiler will contain timing information. This option is enabled by default. A value of "0" will disable profiler timing, while all other values will enable it.

<span class=\"pygments-n\">kProfilerTimi.comment: Value of the --profiler-timing flag that will disable timing information for chrome://profiler.

enable-crash-reporter-for-testing.comment: Used for turning on Breakpad crash reporting in a debug environment where crash reporting is typically compiled but disabled.

disable-low-end-device-mode.comment: Overrides low-end device detection, disabling low-end device optimizations.

enable-low-end-device-mode.comment: Overrides low-end device detection, enabling low-end device optimizations.

load-and-launch-app.comment: Loads an app from the specified directory and launches it.

ash-animate-from-boot-splash-screen.comment: Enables an animated transition from the boot splash screen (Chrome logo on a white background) to the login screen.  Implies |kAshCopyHostBackgroundAtBoot| and doesn't make much sense if used in conjunction with |kDisableBootAnimation| (since the transition begins at the same time as the white/grayscale login screen animation).

ash-constrain-pointer-to-root.comment: Constrains the pointer movement within a root window on desktop.

ash-copy-host-background-at-boot.comment: Copies the host window's content to the system background layer at startup. Can make boot slightly slower, but also hides an even-longer awkward period where we display a white background if the login wallpaper takes a long time to load.

ash-debug-shortcuts.comment: Enable keyboard shortcuts useful for debugging.

ash-default-wallpaper-is-oem.comment: Indicates that the wallpaper images specified by kAshDefaultWallpaper{Large,Small} are OEM-specific (i.e. they are not downloadable from Google).

ash-default-wallpaper-large.comment: Default wallpaper to use (as paths to trusted, non-user-writable JPEG files).

ash-disable-alternate-caption-button.comment: Use the normal visual style for the caption buttons (minimize, maximize, restore, close).

ash-disable-docked-windows.comment: Disable ability to dock windows at the desktop edge.

ash-enable-alternate-caption-button.comment: Use alternate visual style for the caption buttons (minimize, maximize, restore, close). The alternate style: - Adds a dedicated button for minimize. - Removes the maximize button's help bubble.

ash-enable-magnifier-key-scroller.comment: Enables key bindings to scroll magnified screen.

ash-enable-touch-view-testing.comment: Enables touch view testing. TODO(skuhne): Remove TOGGLE_TOUCH_VIEW_TESTING accelerator once this flag is removed.

ash-enable-system-sounds.comment: When this flag is set, system sounds will be played whether the ChromeVox is enabled or not.

ash-enable-tray-dragging.comment: Enables showing the tray bubble by dragging on the shelf.

ash-guest-wallpaper-large.comment: Wallpaper to use in guest mode (as paths to trusted, non-user-writable JPEG files).

ash-hide-notifications-for-factory.comment: Hides notifications that are irrelevant to Chrome OS device factory testing, such as battery level updates.

ash-host-window-bounds.comment: Sets a window size, optional position, and optional scale factor. "1024x768" creates a window of size 1024x768. "100+200-1024x768" positions the window at 100,200. "1024x768*2" sets the scale factor to 2 for a high DPI display.

ash-secondary-display-layout.comment: Specifies the layout mode and offsets for the secondary display for testing. The format is "<t|r|b|l>,<offset>" where t=TOP, r=RIGHT, b=BOTTOM and L=LEFT. For example, 'r,-100' means the secondary display is positioned on the right with -100 offset. (above than primary)

ash-touch-hud.comment: Enables the heads-up display for tracking touch points.

ash-use-first-display-as-internal.comment: Uses the 1st display in --ash-host-window-bounds as internal display. This is for debugging on linux desktop.

aura-legacy-power-button.comment: (Most) Chrome OS hardware reports ACPI power button releases correctly. Standard hardware reports releases immediately after presses.  If set, we lock the screen or shutdown the system immediately in response to a press instead of displaying an interactive animation.

ash-force-desktop.comment: Force Ash to open its root window on the desktop, even on Windows 8 where it would normally end up in metro.

channel.comment: Can't find the switch you are looking for? try looking in base/base_switches.cc instead. The value of this switch tells the child process which IPC channel the browser expects to use to communicate with it.

..\/chromeos\/chromeos_switches.comment: The switches below only work with Chrome OS

app-mode-oem-manifest.comment: Path for app's OEM manifest file.

ash-webui-init.comment: When wallpaper boot animation is not disabled this switch is used to override OOBE/sign in WebUI init type. Possible values: parallel|postpone. Default: parallel.

dbus-stub.comment: Forces the stub implementation of dbus clients.

derelict-detection-timeout.comment: Time before a machine at OOBE is considered derelict.

derelict-idle-timeout.comment: Time before a derelict machines starts demo mode.

disable-boot-animation.comment: Disables wallpaper boot animation (except of OOBE case).
