disable-enterprise-user-reporting.comment: Disables reporting recently logged in users for enterprise-managed devices.

disable-genius-app.comment: Disable Genius App and use the original Help App instead.

disable-login-animations.comment: Avoid doing expensive animations upon login.

disable-new-kiosk-ui.comment: Disables new Kiosk UI when kiosk apps are represented as user pods.

disable-quickoffice-component-app.comment: Disable Quickoffice component app thus handlers won't be registered so it will be possible to install another version as normal app for testing.

disable-network-portal-notification.comment: Disables notifications about captive portals in session.

echo-ext-path.comment: Enables overriding the path for the default echo component extension. Useful for testing.

enable-carrier-switching.comment: Enables switching between different cellular carriers from the UI.

enable-consumer-management.comment: Enables consumer management, which allows user to enroll, remotely lock and locate the device.

enable-network-portal-notification.comment: Enables notifications about captive portals in session.

enable-kiosk-mode.comment: Enables touchpad three-finger-click as middle button. Enable Kiosk mode for ChromeOS. Note this switch refers to retail mode rather than the kiosk app mode.

enable-request-tablet-site.comment: Enables request of tablet site (via user agent override).

enterprise-enable-forced-re-enrollment.comment: Whether to enable forced enterprise re-enrollment.

enterprise-enrollment-initial-modulus.comment: Power of the power-of-2 initial modulus that will be used by the auto-enrollment client. E.g. "4" means the modulus will be 2^4 = 16.

enterprise-enrollment-modulus-limit.comment: Power of the power-of-2 maximum modulus that will be used by the auto-enrollment client.

enterprise-enrollment-skip-robot-auth.comment: Don't create robot account on enrollment. Used when testing device enrollment against YAPS or the Python test server.

file-manager-enable-new-audio-player.comment: Enables the new audio player in the Files.app.

file-manager-enable-new-gallery.comment: Enables the new gallery in the Files.app.

first-exec-after-boot.comment: Passed to Chrome the first time that it's run after the system boots. Not passed on restart after sign out.

force-login-manager-in-tests.comment: Usually in browser tests the usual login manager bringup is skipped so that tests can change how it's brought up. This flag disables that.

bwsi.comment: Indicates that the browser is in "browse without sign-in" (Guest session) mode. Should completely disable extensions, sync and bookmarks.

has-chromeos-keyboard.comment: If true, the Chromebook has a Chrome OS keyboard. Don't use the flag for Chromeboxes.

has-chromeos-diamond-key.comment: If true, the Chromebook has a keyboard with a diamond key.

kiosk-mode-screensaver-path.comment: Path for the screensaver used in Kiosk mode

login-password.comment: Specifies a password to be used to login (along with login-user).

login-profile.comment: Specifies the profile to use once a chromeos user is logged in.

login-user.comment: Specifies the user which is already logged in.

oobe-skip-postlogin.comment: Skips all other OOBE pages after user login.

oobe-timer-interval.comment: Interval at which we check for total time on OOBE.

oobe-guest-session.comment: Indicates that a guest session has been started before OOBE completion.

power-stub.comment: Specifies power stub behavior:  'cycle=2' - Cycles power states every 2 seconds. See FakeDBusThreadManager::ParsePowerCommandLineSwitch for full details.

shill-stub.comment: Specifies network stub behavior. If this switch is not specified, ethernet, wifi and vpn are enabled by default, and transitions occur instantaneously. Multiple options can be comma separated (no spaces). See FakeShillManagerClient::SetInitialNetworkState for implementation. Examples:  'wifi=on' - A wifi network is initially connected ('1' also works)  'wifi=off' - Wifi networks are all initially disconnected ('0' also works)  'wifi=disabled' - Wifi is initially disabled  'wifi=none' - Wifi is unavailable  'wifi=portal' - Wifi connection will be in Portal state  'cellular=1' - Cellular is initially connected  'interactive=3' - Interactive mode, connect/scan/etc requests take 3 secs

sms-test-messages.comment: Sends test messages on first call to RequestUpdate (stub only).

stub-cros-settings.comment: Indicates that a stub implementation of CrosSettings that stores settings in memory without signing should be used, treating current user as the owner. This option is for testing the chromeos build of chrome on the desktop only.

enable-first-run-ui-transitions.comment: Enables animated transitions during first-run tutorial.

force-first-run-ui.comment: Forces first-run UI to be shown for every login.

test-auto-update-ui.comment: Enables testing for auto update UI.

spdy-proxy-auth-origin.comment: The origin of the data reduction proxy.

spdy-proxy-dev-auth-origin.comment: The origin of the data reduction proxy dev.

spdy-proxy-auth-fallback.comment: The origin of the data reduction proxy fallback.

spdy-proxy-auth-value.comment: A test key for data reduction proxy authentication.

data-reduction-proxy-probe-url.comment: Sets a canary URL to test before committing to using the data reduction proxy. Note this canary does not go through the data reduction proxy.

do-not-ignore-autocomplete-off.comment: Forces the password manager to not ignore autocomplete='off' for password forms.

disable-password-generation.comment: Disables password generation when we detect that the user is going through account creation.

enable-password-generation.comment: Enables password generation when we detect that the user is going through account creation.

local-heuristics-only-for-password-gener.comment: Removes the requirement that we recieved a ping from the autofill servers and that the user doesn't have the given form blacklisted. Used in testing.

show-autofill-type-predictions.comment: Annotates forms with Autofill field type predictions.

wallet-secure-service-url.comment: Secure service URL for Online Wallet service. Used as the base url to escrow credit card numbers.

wallet-service-url.comment: Service URL for Online Wallet service. Used as the base url for Online Wallet API calls.

wallet-service-use-sandbox.comment: Use the sandbox Online Wallet service URL (for developer testing).

disable-translate.comment: Allows disabling of translate from the command line to assist with automated browser testing (e.g. Selenium/WebDriver). Normal browser users should disable translate with the preference.

translate-script-url.comment: Overrides the default server used for Google Translate.

translate-security-origin.comment: Overrides security-origin with which Translate runs in an isolated world.

cloud-policy-invalidation-delay.comment: The maximum amount of delay in ms between receiving a cloud policy invalidation and fetching the policy. A random delay up to this value is used to prevent Chrome clients from overwhelming the cloud policy server when a policy which affects many users is changed.

device-management-url.comment: Specifies the URL at which to fetch configuration policy from the device management backend. Specifying this switch turns on managed policy from the device management backend.

enable-component-cloud-policy.comment: Enables fetching and storing cloud policy for components.

disable-policy-key-verification.comment: Disables the verification of policy signing keys. TODO(atwilson): Remove this once all test servers have been updated to produce verification signatures.

fake-cloud-policy-type.comment: Registers for cloud policy using the BROWSER client type instead of the ANDROID_BROWSER or IOS_BROWSER types. This allows skipping the server whitelist. TODO(joaodasilva): remove this. http://crbug.com/248527

enable-precache.comment: Enables the proactive populating of the disk cache with Web resources that are likely to be needed in future page fetches.

precache-config-settings-url.comment: The URL that provides the PrecacheConfigurationSettings proto.

precache-manifest-url-prefix.comment: Precache manifests will be served from URLs with this prefix.

clear-token-service.comment: Clears the token service before using it. This allows simulating the expiration of credentials during testing.

enable-web-based-signin.comment: Enables the pure web-based flow for sign in on first run/NTP/wrench menu/ settings page.

fast-user-switching.comment: Allows displaying the list of existing profiles in the avatar bubble for fast switching between profiles.

google-profile-info.comment: Enables using GAIA information to populate profile name and icon.

new-avatar-menu.comment: Use new avatar menu. When combined with new-profile-management, it simply shows the new profile management avatar menu. Otherwise it shows a redesigned avatar menu with the same functionality as the old one, plus a tutorial card at the top prompting the user to try out the new profile management UI.

new-profile-management.comment: Use new profile management system, including profile sign-out and new choosers.
